definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: I was teaching them some paper folding.
He is very clever with his hands and can make beautiful origami .
sentences.chinese: 他的手很巧，能做很漂亮的折纸手工。

sentences.english: It was the first time that she saw people making paper ingot and people making scoop.
sentences.chinese: 第一次看到人们折纸元宝，打铁勺。

sentences.english: Learn how to fold an origami samurai hat.
sentences.chinese: 学习如何折一折纸武士帽。

sentences.english: Tearing paper is different from ripping paper.
sentences.chinese: 简单的撕纸和巧妙地折纸是不同的。

sentences.english: Horses are more advanced origami models that are fun to create anywhere.
sentences.chinese: 马是更先进的折纸模型，建立地方很有趣。

sentences.english: My father had a nervous breakdown and cut my homework up to make paper dolls.
sentences.chinese: 我老爸有点神经失常，把作业剪裁开来折纸玩偶了。

sentences.english: One idea for an origami wedding craft idea is to fold paper flowers to use as decorative pieces.
sentences.chinese: 一个用于婚礼折纸工艺思想观念是折叠纸花作装饰件。

sentences.english: Traditional origami keepsake box with four compartments.
sentences.chinese: 传统的折纸纪念品盒四格。

sentences.english: The ancient art of origami paper folding is a precise and delicate art form.
sentences.chinese: 古老的折纸艺术是一种准确而精美的艺术形式。

sentences.english: Make a rocket out of paper with tips from an origami specialist in this free video on paper art.
sentences.chinese: 让火箭从一折纸专家在此免费视频纸艺术纸与技巧。

sentences.english: Wood's technique bears similarities to origami.
sentences.chinese: 伍德所发明的技术与折纸类似。

sentences.english: Thus to study the potential of the origami craft in the clothing market.
sentences.chinese: 进而探讨折纸工艺在服装市场中的发展潜力。

definition: papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
